name: Golgotha
storyline:
In 1942, Black Waters Station was overcome by a toxic and poisonous fog that killed thousands of people as they slept in the tunnels and platforms of the station to escape the war. After the horrific ordeal the authorities closed the doors to Black Waters and sealed it off to the public.

In 2003 the station was officially reopened to the public. But after several freak accidents and unexplainable deaths, it was once again closed for good.

It has been abandoned and undisturbed for over 20 years.

Until now…
summary: Dare to explore the most haunted vicinity in all of England? You will leave no stone unturned as you walk along the eerie grounds of the Black Waters Station and uncover the horror that lies within.
